This game reminds me of when I used to play computer games at school on LAN when we were supposed to be reading fairy tales or looking at pictures of plants. The teacher couldn't tell we were playing half-life LOL. anyways this game is awesome because you can frag people and KILL Barney over and over and over again something I couldn't do with my father watching over my shoulder in my childhood. This game is violent and has an epic rocket launcher. I think this game was inspired by a game called Quake, seems pretty obscure and unknown but I might try it out some time. There's also this guy who has an inappropriate name who is bully me on the internet!!!! I hate him I blocked him, LOSER!!

I regret buying this game over the fact that I am just too good and i suffer from boring games where i do nothing but own on this kid named xekez. It is physically and psychologically fatiguing to keep playing this game. Xekez if you are reading this you suck and i did your mom kid. Santa isnt real and your dad is a stripper.
This game is physically exhausting and I have been fatigued for 3 weeks after a 1 hour play session.

It would be good if there were any servers online. The game itself is good, but you can't play a multiplayer game with no players. Save your money.

Edit: By some miracle, I was able to find 2 servers with players online. However, I will keep the thumbs down because even though it can happen, it barley ever does.

This game is genuinly good and I could see events and tournaments happening within it in the modern gaming world. It's the classic deathmatch feeling and chaos, taking the foundations of games like Quake and bringing them to the half life world. If you are in a party and you have a pack of controllers, it's a good passtime. It has some great maps, small enough to make the player always be in a fight and speed here is the key, you move fast and smoothly. It's cheap and I would love to see it get more attention (this is kinda imposible but hey, I can dream). I wish more games like this will be made in the future.
ngl this game looks like it was made before half life. It's probably because the visuals remind me of Quake.
Why would you play this in 2021? I mean it's not bad, but why?

Хотелось бы поставить "палец вверх", но вообще не за что. Об игре: переделка первого квейка на goldsrc. Всё. Игра мертвее всех мётрвых. Даже если и удастся найти сервер с более 0 человек, то там будут сидеть лютые задроты. Ни в коем случае не покупайте её отдельно. Мне она досталась от Valve Complete Pack и теперь по сути нужна для того, чтобы счётчик моих игр был на 1 больше.

Онлайна нет, серверов мало, пинг высокий. Если что, это многопользовательская игра.

EL JUEGO ESTÁ MUERTO

En Deathmatch Classic no encontrarás a ni un sólo - ni 1 - jugador en cualquier servidor del mundo. Y los poco servidores que quedan cuentan con bots y otros están vacíos. De esos servidores con bots, alguno de ellos ni te hacen caso y no puedes hacerles daño (está mal configurado). Entonces se hace complicado si quiera jugarlo con la computadora. Y como el juego no tiene modo campaña o historia, pues... para qué comprar un juego que nadie juega, ¿cierto? 

Saludos!

ВЫ ЧЕ ТАМ ПОЗДЫХАЛИ ЧИ ШО ЕПТИЛЬ

A Quake style arena shooter adaptation for Half-Life Deathmatch. This used to be included with retail versions of Half-Life (and you might still get it for free with the Steam release? Not sure) but I don't see much point in buying it as a standalone. If you want Quake style gameplay, play Quake.

★★★☆☆

Do you want to feel special? Do you want to feel like one in a million? Boot up this game and you will be one of the only people in the world playing Deathmatch Classic. If you can find a couple of friends to play the game with, it can be a total blast. 

GoldSrc is a heavily modified quake engine which is seen in the game Half-Life. The game, I'm pretty sure, runs on GoldSrc but has a lot more of a Quake feel to it with the similar sound effects, map design and guns being centered on the screen,

I love GoldSrc games.

But this one is just not worth getting anymore.
It's heavily inspired by Quake, but it's outdated by comparison.

Nobody plays this anymore and has no bot support.
The map selection is lackluster(though you can expand with community maps).

Overall there are cheaper(Or even free!) arena FPS games you can find on both Steam and outside of Steam.
If anything most people have this now because they bought the Valve Complete Pack.
